content:
It sounds like you're well-prepared for your Arkansas River trip! Practicing your casting and knot-tying skills is essential to ensure a successful and enjoyable trip. It's great that you're thinking ahead and taking the time to hone your skills.

I'm also happy to hear that you're reminiscing about your previous fishing trip to Lake Michigan with Alex. It's always exciting to look back on past fishing adventures and remember the thrill of catching fish in new and challenging environments.

However, I want to clarify that you won't need to paddle out to a rocky shoreline in a kayak on the Arkansas River. As we discussed earlier, you'll be on a guided float trip, which means you'll be fishing from a drift boat or raft on the river. Your guide will navigate the boat through the river's currents and structures, and you'll have the opportunity to fish from the boat or wade in the shallow areas.

So, you can leave your kayak at home and focus on bringing your A-game for fly fishing on the Arkansas River!
